name: Caphe House (Bermondsey Street)
short_title: Authentic Vietnamese pho, big flavours and cult egg coffee
summary: Caphe House is a much-loved Vietnamese café-restaurant on Bermondsey Street, widely praised for serving some of the best pho in London. It’s casual, welcoming and family-run in feel, with a menu built around deep aromatic broths, fresh herbs and generous bowls. Their cult egg coffee is another major draw, making it a go-to for comforting, flavour-packed meals throughout the day.
what_diners_love: Exceptional pho broth—fragrant, light yet deeply flavourful
Authentic Vietnamese flavours praised by diners familiar with Vietnam
Egg coffee: rich, velvety and often described as the best in the UK
Friendly, efficient service with quick turnaround
Strong vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free options
popular_dishes: Bún bò Huế (spicy lemongrass noodle soup)
atmosphere_experience: Small, bright and relaxed with a calm daytime vibe and a steady buzz at meal times. The setup is efficient and casual, including QR-code ordering and fast service. Well suited to solo diners, families and casual catch-ups, though it isn’t designed for lingering long dinners.
good_to_know: Pho is the headline act and what most diners come for
Prices can be higher than some Vietnamese spots, but portions are usually generous
Ordering and payment typically via QR code (no cash)
Takeaway and delivery available (delivery timing depends on third-party apps)
Egg coffee contains raw egg—important for allergies and dietary preferences
mixed_feedback: Some diners find pho pricing high (often nearing £18–20)
Occasional comments about inconsistency on non-pho dishes
top_tip: For a first visit, go straight for the rare beef & brisket pho and finish with an egg coffee—the combo most often described as unforgettable.
